Package soot.jimple.infoflow.data.pathBuilders

Class ContextSensitivePathBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.data.pathBuilders.AbstractAbstractionPathBuilder
      • soot.jimple.infoflow.data.pathBuilders.ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
        • soot.jimple.infoflow.data.pathBuilders.ContextSensitivePathBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAbstractionPathBuilder, IMemoryBoundedSolver
    public class ContextSensitivePathBuilder
extends ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
    Class for reconstructing abstraction paths from sinks to source. This builder is context-sensitive which makes it more precise than the ContextInsensitivePathBuilder, but also a bit slower.
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • checkForSource

        protected boolean checkForSource​(Abstraction abs,
                                 SourceContextAndPath scap)
        Checks whether the given abstraction is a source. If so, a result entry is created.
        Parameters:
        abs - The abstraction to check
        scap - The path leading up to the current abstraction
        Returns:
        True if the current abstraction is a source, otherwise false

      • runIncrementalPathCompuation

        public void runIncrementalPathCompuation()
        Description copied from interface: IAbstractionPathBuilder
        Incrementally runs the path builder after some paths have already been computed. This method is usually called after the taint propagation has finished when incremental path building has been used in between.

      • computeTaintPaths

        public void computeTaintPaths​(Set<AbstractionAtSink> res)
        Description copied from interface: IAbstractionPathBuilder
        Computes the path of tainted data between the source and the sink
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • getTaintPathTask

        protected Runnable getTaintPathTask​(AbstractionAtSink abs)
        Description copied from class: ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
        Gets the task that computes the result paths for a single abstraction. If the concrete path building algorithm does not want to handle the given abstraction, it can return null to not execute anything.
        Specified by:
        getTaintPathTask in class ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
        Parameters:
        abs - The abstraction for which to compute the result paths

      • getResults

        public InfoflowResults getResults()
        Description copied from interface: IAbstractionPathBuilder
        Gets the constructed result paths
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        getResults in class ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
        Returns:
        The constructed result paths

      • triggerComputationForNeighbors

        protected boolean triggerComputationForNeighbors()
        Description copied from class: ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
        Specifies whether the class shall create separate path reconstruction tasks for the neighbors of the abstractions that arrive at the sink
        Specified by:
        triggerComputationForNeighbors in class ConcurrentAbstractionPathBuilder
        Returns:
        True if separate path reconstruction tasks shall be started for each neighbor of each abstraction that reaches a sink, false if only the abstraction itself shall trigger a path reconstruction task
